website_summaries.verdict: With a rubber grip and a fiberglass core to absorb blows, it's a sure and steady hammer for an appealing price.
pros: Head and handle are bonded with epoxy for durability and strength
Head is made of forged steel
cons: Some owners say the head comes loose in spite of epoxy bonding

customer_reviews.title: The head has become loose, and wobbles.
customer_reviews.text: I use this hammer infrequently, but even if I used it hard, it should remain a usable and safe tool. Unfortunately, the head has become loose, and wobbles. Fortunately, I discovered this problem before it caused bodily injury or property damage. If you have purchased a jacketed fiberglass ball-pein hammer from Tekton, I would suggest checking to make sure the head is secure.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Its okay. .
customer_reviews.text: Im a mechanic so this gets used fairly often, but after maybe a week of use the head already started separating from the handle. At first it was just a little loose, wasn't bothered by it. A couple uses later and there doesn't seem to be much of anything holding the head to the handle anymore and I'm afraid that one of these times I'll swing it and that head is just going to fly off. Whatever that black resin looking stuff they put in the top to try and secure it with just doesn't do the job. First TEKTON tool I've been disappointed with, hopefully the last.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It goes the distance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hammer over 4 years ago. I was a little surprised to see that I had not written a review for it. My hammer has been through the ringer. Because of its low price, it was what I considered a "throw away" tool. I intended to use it for welding school and assumed it would break from the abuse. NOT THE CASE. It is made very well. I can only hope that the rest of there hammer line are still built this way. I plan to buy more hammers from them. The price for there hammer set is pretty awesome, and if they are built like this one, I'll never need another set again.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Vigilance

customer_reviews.title: Good hammers
customer_reviews.text: They are hammers. They hammer things. These Tekton types seem to be made well and are appealing to look at. I haven't put them through their paces yet, but seem like they will perform well. No wobble in the head or looseness during swing. It's all tight and sure. The fact that I got 4 of these hammers for the price of 2 at a local store is a big bonus. Big Tekton fan now.
customer_reviews.author: B wake

customer_reviews.title: THE TEKTON BALL PEIN HAMMER IS WELL WORTH PURCHASING
customer_reviews.text: TEKTON 30402 Jacketed Fiberglass Ball Pein Hammer, 12-Ounce - This hammer is perfect for shaping softer metals as I do often, the weight is just right for my applications and the hammer has a somewhat unique look to it with its red, fiberglass sleeve. I’ve been very impressed with the TEKTON brand and it decent quality standards, it’s well worth the price that I paid (about $11.00 or so).
customer_reviews.author: BOOKEM

customer_reviews.title: Emergency gear to have.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of hammers to keep in the truck just in case. You know you will always need a hammer and a screwdriver. The price point on these are very low. Buy these hammers put them in you vehicle and forget them. They will be there when you need them and they will work well. Best be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Patriotic purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer. I love TEKTON tools and use them on a daily basis. I bought this hammer for a set of tools that I have been using in an automotive shop and it has performed great. The fiberglass shaft is very durable and helps to absorb any shock to your hands. The rubber grip is very comfortable and allows to user to always maintain great control of the tool. I would recommend TEKTON tools to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Ricks Munn

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price. Nice rubber handle.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad set of Ball Pein hammers. Should be all of the sizes i'll ever need. The rubber grip seems to be decent quality. Time will tell how they hold up. Will update this review if there is anything of note.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great set can't go wrong with
customer_reviews.text: Solid set of hammers to have around and a phenominal price for them. These aren't your top of the line hammers and they aren't dead blow but they are a heck of a deal for what you get. Feels very nice. Work well, constructed well and just an all around great set of hammers.
customer_reviews.author: Natural44

customer_reviews.title: Hammer for car
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small hammer to keep in my car in case of emergencies. The fiberglass shaft makes it light weight, easy to store. Will do the job you need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer but Not for Precise Shaping
customer_reviews.text: This is a $9.00 hammer. I don't use it for precise metal shaping, and I don't recommend that you do either. I use it occasionally to crudely shape metal in the engine bay, or in other applications requiring a metal hammer, ball or flat. Looking at the situation this way, I recommend this piece and you should buy one to throw in the toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyChrome

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Solid Company
customer_reviews.text: Tekton stands behind their products and makes it right, as I was shipped a perfect replacement to one defective hammer I got in this set. Buy with confidence, they're a pleasure to work with should you have to. With the dozens of Tekton tools I've bought, I've been happy with every single one.
customer_reviews.author: MinnesotaMan

customer_reviews.title: very happy overall.
customer_reviews.text: Need a decent ball peen...here you go..I ordered the heavier one as i needed a larger hammer to bash off big drums and rotors on cars...and yes ive had some really really stuck 13 in drums that I knew i would not be able to turn so a couple wacks abd they were off...very happy overall...its a bit unweidly but it usually breaks stuff loose 1st or 2nd hit with a decent swing...good hammer to add to the bunch
customer_reviews.author: Nick D.

customer_reviews.title: Straight to the point
customer_reviews.text: The grip is comfortable, Heavy duty hammer, i use it for knocking out bearings and driving in nails, no issues so far
customer_reviews.author: AMZNSTU

customer_reviews.title: Big Hammer!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a hammer! When I hit things with this hammer they really stay hit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Sennert

customer_reviews.title: Ball Pein Hammer
customer_reviews.text: A hammer is a hammer to me. I'm sure there's better handles and better weight proportioned calculations that go into more expensive hammers, but if you need a ball pein hammer for small, personal and/or home projects - this hammer will do the trick. Had it for about a month and have used it on numerous projects thus far. It's holding up quite well. Haven't had any issues with it yet
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer! Nice grip, good weight
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this hammer!! Weird to say that sentence! I make my own jewelry and this hammer is the best one I have ever used. Comfortable grip, nice weight, Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Ramella

customer_reviews.title: TEKTON 30401 Jacketed Fiberglass Ball Pein Hammer, 8-Ounce
customer_reviews.text: OK this TEKTON 30401 Jacketed Fiberglass Ball Pein Hammer, 8-Ounce weight was about what I needed. Was assembling a tsuba, seppa and Tsuka and needed a light tapping device. This came out while looking through the options and I am happy with it. My one pound ball bein was a bit much and it is back out in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: CDP's Onceagain habit of purchasingTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say really, it's a hunk of ...
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say really, it's a hunk of metal on a stick, and it's kind of hard to mess that up. I've used it for some light metal work, adding some 'artistic' hand crafting designs to brass and aluminum shoe and bracelet tags and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: TREX

customer_reviews.title: These hammers are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These hammers are awesome! I like them so much I bought another set, and I bought individual ones to have the full line. Great value and they hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Seems durable and made well
customer_reviews.text: Seems durable and haven't had a chance to really wack anything but from my light use it should be fine

customer_reviews.title: Big things come in small packages
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in my hand and tire checks for any defects so as to keep safe on the road

customer_reviews.text: Larger than I thought it would be. Too large for everyday jewelry making. Sturdy and large.

customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. It’s difficult to find a ball pein hammer in my area but this hammer met my needs. Cannot beat the price.

customer_reviews.title: Good for replacing ceramic floor tile with cold chisel

customer_reviews.title: This hammer is huge
customer_reviews.text: This hammer will get anything done. I work as a mechanic and my co-workers are constantly asking me to borrow it to get something loose or simply break it. One of my best purchases on Amazon, and that's saying something.

customer_reviews.title: These hammers are great, I got solid blows from the 24 ouncer
customer_reviews.text: These hammers are great, I got solid blows from the 24 ouncer, good for the price definitely, the handles are firm but comfortable and they do take the impact well, have not had use for the 12 and the 16 yet but I've used the 8 and 24 a bunch and so far they have done the job nicely.

customer_reviews.title: Been using for work daily. Very durable and very strong.
customer_reviews.text: Been using for work daily. Very durable and very strong.Been using for work daily. Very durable and very strong.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality, Made in China.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, made in China. I can't fault it for that, but in retrospect I wish I'd paid $4 more for the Stanley, at least I think those are made in the US. Needed something medium sized and light, and this fits the bill. For serious bashing, it's better to go for an all-steel handle, but this is fine for medium work.

As a machine maintenance technician, my tools get heavy use and this hammer has been used more times than I can count and it has handled everything perfectly. The fiberglass handle is strong and lightweight and the hammer feels perfectly weighted for maximum force. Would definitely purchase again.

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn't great, but the price is right.
customer_reviews.text: The fit and finish on these isn't as good as I expected, but I can't complain for the price. The side faces are a little uneven and the metal is sprayed with some kind of clear coat that is peeling. I expect them to rust quickly. The fiberglass handles are pretty rough around the edges.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for DIY  family and friends

customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked fine for me. The handle does feel pretty good, and for the money its hard to beat.

customer_reviews.title: HAMMAAAAR!
customer_reviews.text: It's a hammer. There isn't anything to say really... It can drive nails, and smash things. It can smooth metal and so on. The handle has survived massive abuse, which I sort of just take for granted, since that's its purpose.

customer_reviews.title: Better than you'd expect for the cheap price, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a nice little hammer. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the head material is very prone to dings and other damage. I was tapping out an alignment tool with the side of the metal head and while I understand that's not the way this tool is meant to be used, it left many dings on the head. This is probably a perfect hammer for occasional home use, but if you plan on using it for career work you might want to consider investing in something of higher quality. Other than that, this was a great purchase for a great price.

product_meta.title: TEKTON 30403 Jacketed Fiberglass Ball Pein Hammer, 16-Ounce
product_meta.description: Size:16 ounceDeliver a powerful, sure strike in comfort with the TEKTON 30403 16 oz. Ball Pein Hammer. Made from high-strength, lightweight fiberglass, the virtually unbreakable handle core naturally dampens stinging vibrations. A poly jacket completely surrounds the core and protects it like a bulletproof vest, absorbing the impact of missed strikes. The smoothly rounded ball end lets you work and shape sheet metal to just the right contour. Grab a hold of the soft, non-slip rubber grip and experience the ultimate in comfort. Since it is a directly integrated piece of the handle, it can never pull loose like hammers that use a push-on grip.
feature_bullets: High-strength Fiberglass handle core helps absorb vibrations
Exterior poly jacket protects handle core from missed strikes
Soft and comfortable, non-slip rubber grip
Permanent head-to-handle epoxy bond will not loosen over time
